intro: Sporobolus patens, commonly known as sand dropseed, is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by wind, a feature that aids in its survival in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Sporobolus patens is also valued for its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
